title: Speeches on Taiwan's Indigenous Issues
department: 原住民族研究國際博士班
author: Ms. Dungi黃怡瑄
content:
分類： 活動公告
來源： 原住民族研究國際博士班 - Ms. Dungi黃怡瑄 - dungi@gms.ndhu.edu.tw - 電話+886 3 8905760
對象： 全校教職員
標題： Speeches on Taiwan's Indigenous Issues
日期： Tue, 2 Apr 2024 15:34:14 +0800
附檔： April 9th-Dr. Daniel Davies.png (678 KB)   April 10th-Dr. Jeroen van Bekhoven(貝傑仁).png (591 KB)   April 11th-Dr. Maksim Groza(雷鋒).png (551 KB)   
The International Ph.D. Program in Indigenous Studies is hosting a series of speeches from April 9th to 11th, focusing on Taiwan's indigenous vote behavior, law, and identity issues.

Dr. Daniel Davies, Dr. Jeroen van Bekhoven(貝傑仁), and Dr. Maksim Groza(雷鋒) are three distinguished experts who will share their extensive knowledge and research from both international and local experiences and provide valuable insights into the complexities surrounding Taiwan and the world's indigenous communities.

Each speech will last 30 minutes, followed by a 15-minute Q&A session.

April 9th / PM 5:10-5:55
Emotion and Indigenous Voter Mobilization in Southern Taiwan - Dr. Daniel Davies
at Room A318, College of Indigenous Studies
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
April 10th / PM 5:10-5:55
An Incomplete Makeover? Decolonization and Democratization in Taiwan and Paraguay - Dr. Jeroen van Bekhoven貝傑仁
Live On Google Meet (link will be sent once sign up)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
April 11th / PM 12:10-12:55
Indigenous Identity As a Process - Dr. Maksim Groza雷鋒
at Room A318, College of Indigenous Studies

These enlightening events are open to everyone, especially graduate-level students, and have a capacity of 15 seats. Please sign up first to ensure you don't miss out on this unique opportunity. I've attached the registration links to each speech poster here.

Sincerely,
Dungi


Program Assistant
International Ph.D. Program in Indigenous Studies
College of Indigenous Studies, National Dong Hwa University
T：+886-3-8905760
https://ndhu.intl.phd.indigenous-studies.com
